urls.title: Analysis | Did the pandemic shake Chinese citizens’ trust in their government? We surveyed nearly 20,000 people to find out.
urls.description: We interviewed nearly 20,000 citizens to find out.

tweets.text:
A recent poll showed that #COVID19 boosted Chinese citizens' trust in the government.
The trust in the national government rose to 98%. Trust levels rose to 93% at the county level, 94% at the city level and 95% at the provincial level.
https://t.co/Xp5ODy3PJZ

While West media make ridiculous claims about "forced labor" in technology-intensive polysilicon industry in #Xinjiang, GT reporters visited a factory there to find out about the truth. https://t.co/KmWzvTcTbZ https://t.co/TjCMfgdXPK

urls.title: Xinjiang: what the West doesn’t tell you about China’s war on terror
urls.description: In 2002, the US and the UN both declared a Uygur militant group a terrorist organisation. The US then considered China a partner in the war on terror. When the Trump administration delisted the East Turkestan Islamic Movement, it allowed the West to frame China’s anti-terror measures as ethnic persecution.

tweets.text:
A SCMP article points out how the West intentionally negated China's counter-terrorism achievements and accused China of "genocide" in Xinjiang.
https://t.co/c6NKSljaOq

Consul General Zhou and Governor Beazley planted a ginkgo tree together which symbolizes the long term friendship between Guangdong&NSW. Both spoke highly of the friendly exchanges&fruitful cooperation since establishment of sister relationship between the two sides in 1979.

At the invitation of NSW Governor H.E. Hon. Margaret Beazley,Consul General H.E.
